page.title: 07WILDLIFE IN THE PRIDDY AREA
page.content: The Mendip Hills play host to a wide variety of widlife. In Stockhill Forest deer can be found, especially if you go there early in the morning. The forest and the surrounding heathland is also the home for adders. Badgers,foxes and rabbits can be found in profusion but not many squirrels. There is a great range of birds to be seen. Woodpeckers can be heard at work in the forest while hawks swoop and hover over the heaths. One small creature has become a local delicacy, the snail. One local restaurant serves them as a speciality. A wide range of pond life can be found in Priddy Pools. These are pools which remain from the lead mining operations in the area.
